bibl.title: State of Nebraska DEPARTMENT OF INSURANCE Summary of Insurance Business in Nebraska for the year 1934

p.seg: State of Nebraska DEPARTMENT OF INSURANCE Summary of Insurance Business in Nebraska for the year 1934 Also Comparative Figures of Authorized Companies for the years 1931. 1932 and 1933

..■•. i . • : - To His Excellency, Governor Roy L. Cochran: We respectfully submit the summary of business of companies authorized to write insurance m this State for the year ending December 31, 1934. DEPARTMENT OP INSURANCE, JOHN S. LOGAN, Director.

NEBRASKA INSURANCE REPORT COMPANIES REINSURING, MERGING, OR WITHDRAWING FROM JANUARY 1, 1984 TO JUNE 1, 1035 American Insurance Union, Inc., Columbus, Ohio, withdrew as of April 30, 1934. American Central Burial Insurance Company, Lincoln, Nebraska liquidating in 1934. American Life Insurance Company of Denver, Colorado. Placed in receivership — 1 935. American States Insurance Company, Indianapolis, Indiana with - drew as of April 30, 1934. Belt Casualty Company, Chicago, Illinois, placed in receivership January 2, 1934. Carolina Insurance Company, Wilmington, N. C, withdrew as of February 8, 1934. Colorado Life Company, Denver, Colorado, merged with Gibralter Life and Accident Insurance Company, February 20, 1934. Consolidated Indemnity and Insurance Company, New York, N. Y., placed in hands of the New York Department, May 9, 1934.' Continental Life Insurance Company, St. Louis, Mo., license recoked January 5, 1934. Detroit Fire and Marine Insurance Company, 625 Shelby Street, De - troit, Michigan, withdrew as of December 31, 1934. Farmers Union Mutual Insurance Company of Saunders County, Fre - mont, Nebraska, reinsured, by the Farmers Mutual Insurance Com - pany of Saunders County, Wahoo, Nebraska, January 17, 1935. Hospitalization Corporation, Lincoln, Nebraska. License refused. May 1, 1935. Importers and Exporters Insurance Company of New York, merged with Mohawk Fire Insurance Company, September 4, 1934. Lincoln Fire Insurance Company of New York, withdrew as of April 30, 1935. Manhattan Life Insurance Company, New York City, withdrew as of December 31, 1934. North American Life Insurance Company, Chicago, Illinois, withdrew as of April 30, 1934. North Carolina Home Insurance Company, Raleigh, N. C, withdrew as of April 30, 1934. Security Mutual Life Insurance Company, Binghamton, N. Y., with - drew as of December 31, 1934. Sentinel Life Insurance Company, Kansas City, Missouri, merged with American Savings Life Insurance Company, Kansas City Missouri, November 9, 1934. Southern Fire Insurance Company of New York, withdrew as ot December 31, 1934.

NEBRASKA INSURANCE REPORT COMPANIES CHANGING NAME OR PliAN American Thrift Assurance Company, Omaha, Nebraska, changed name to American Annuity Assurance Compeny, January 30, 1935. Central Catholic Casualty Company, Columbus, Nebraska, changed plan to a mutual legal reserve company, November 3, 1934. Farmers National Co-operative Elevator Mutual Insurance Association of Iowa changed its name to Farmers Elevator Mutual Insurance Association, January 23, 1934. Gibraltar Life & Accident Insurance Company, Denver, Colorado, changed name to Colorado Life Company, Denver, Colorado, Febru - ary 28, 1934. Grand Lodge of the Ancient Order of United Workmen of the State of Nebraska, changed plan to a Co-operative Non-Proilt Life Benefit Association February 5, 1934, and changed name to Pathfinder Life Insurance Company. Indemnity Mutual Marine Assurance Co. Ltd., The, New York, changed name to The Indemnity Marine Assurance Co. Ltd., December 6, 1934. Lincoln Hail Insurance Co., Lincoln, Nebr., changed name to Farmers Union Hail Insurance Company, April 6, 1934. Merchants Casualty Co., Omaha, changed name from Merchants Mutual Burglary Insurance Company, January 10, 1935. National Assurance Corporation, Lincoln, Nebraska, changed plan to Stock Life March 8, 1934. ■ Nebraska Disability Association, Hastings, Nebraska, changed name to Paramount Insurance Corporation, and moved its offices to Omaha, Nebraska May 10, 1934. Pathfinder Life Insurance Co., Grand Island, Nebr., changed plan from a co-operative non-profit life benefit association to a mutual legal reserve life, April 17, 1934. Retail Hardware Mutual Fire Insurance Company changed its name to Hardware Mutual Fire Insurance Company of Minnesota April 24, 1934. Woodmen Accident Company, Lincoln, Nebraska, changed plan to Mutual Legal Reserve, June 1, 1934.
